location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident at Bushire, to The Shaiks Mahomed bin Erraher and Majud bin Erraher, Katiff

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: This item has two different foliation sequences. The first is part of an original foliation sequence which was applied to the whole volume. It is written in ink and appears at the top right (recto) or top left (verso) corner of the folio. The second foliation number is a small pencil number enclosed in a circle which also appears in the top right corner (recto) only, this is the foliation number that has been used in referencing this item.Condition: The item has suffered from insect damage and is difficult to read in places as parts of the text are missing.

mods.abstract: The letter states that braizers have been removed from the Bay of Katiff [Al-Qatif] and gives announcement of Stannus's orders to abstain from all active interference between the Shaikhs and Rahma bin Jabir. It outlines the sending of Rahma bin Jabir's son to Bushire to remonstrate against the war threatened by Shaikh Abdoola bin Ahmed and proposals for peace. Stannus outlines plans to commence negotiations in Katiff.
